content:
• Thursday, January 10, 2013
  • INFY

    Infosys Ltd (NASDAQ:INFY): FQ3 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.91B (+5.8% Y/Y) beats...

    Infosys Ltd (NASDAQ:INFY): FQ3 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.91B (+5.8% Y/Y) beats by $50M. Shares +12% in India. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 PM
  • RPTP

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RPTP +6%. BGCP +4%. VECO +4%. EXEL +4%. MNST +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RPTP +6%. BGCP +4%. VECO +4%. EXEL +4%. MNST +3%.
    After-hours top losers: KBR -8%. XRTX -5%. ABFS -5%. URBN -4%. QLTY -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • T

    It's time for another dose of Leap Wireless (LEAP +9.7%) M&A speculation. Shares rallied...

    It's time for another dose of Leap Wireless (LEAP +9.7%) M&A speculation. Shares rallied over the course of the day after Guggenheim's Shing Yin argued there's a 70% chance MetroPCS (PCS) will make a bid after finishing its merger with T-Mobile USA. Six weeks ago, Yin claimed Sprint might make a bid for MetroPCS within four weeks. Leap, which had a whopping 61.5% of its float shorted on Dec. 14, reportedly held talks at one point about a 3-way deal with MetroPCS and T-Mobile.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • SANW

    Shares of S&W Seed (NASDAQ:SANW) slip in the post session after announcing a secondary...

    Shares of S&W Seed (NASDAQ:SANW) slip in the post session after announcing a secondary offering for an undisclosed size. Piper Jaffray is acting as the sole book-running manager. Shares -4.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) -2.5% AH after again filing to delay the posting of its FQ2 (August...

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) -2.5% AH after again filing to delay the posting of its FQ2 (August quarter) 10-Q. Shares of the beaten-down solid-state drive maker have been treading water in recent weeks following a big rally from Nov. 26-Dec. 5. OCZ has used CES to unveil PCI Express-based SSDs for its high-performance Vector line. (SEC investigation)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • CERE

    Ceres (NASDAQ:CERE): FQ1 EPS of -$0.28 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $2M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $0.7M....

    Ceres (NASDAQ:CERE): FQ1 EPS of -$0.28 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $2M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $0.7M. Shares -3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • KBR

    KBR (NYSE:KBR) cuts FY12 EPS guidance from $2.60 - $2.80 per share to $1.95 - $2.10, well below...

    KBR (NYSE:KBR) cuts FY12 EPS guidance from $2.60 - $2.80 per share to $1.95 - $2.10, well below Street consensus of $2.66, and sees FY13 EPS coming in at around $2.45 - $2.90 per share, versus Street EPS estimates of $2.96. The company blames the miss on significant project charges it expects to take in it's Minerals and U.S. Construction businesses, as well as higher than expected labor cost absorption expenses. Shares -9.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • SNX

    SYNNEX Corporation (NYSE:SNX): Q4 EPS of $1.16 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $2.76B (-2.7% Y/Y)...

    SYNNEX Corporation (NYSE:SNX): Q4 EPS of $1.16 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $2.76B (-2.7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • XRTX

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): Q4 EPS of -$0.24 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $265.4M (-31.5% Y/Y) beats by...

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): Q4 EPS of -$0.24 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $265.4M (-31.5% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares -5.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • BV-OLD

    Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD -16%) fell hard in afternoon trading on news the DOJ has filed an antitrust...

    Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD -16%) fell hard in afternoon trading on news the DOJ has filed an antitrust suit related to the company's completed acquisition of rival PowerReviews. Arguing the deal diminishes competition in the market for online product ratings/review platforms, the DOJ wants Bazaarvoice to divest assets in a way that will create a new competitor.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    Shares of Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) get hit by some volatility going into the close on a rehash of an...

    Shares of Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) get hit by some volatility going into the close on a rehash of an earlier story - posted a few days ago - that the company said it's seen interest from big pharma, but has no plans to sell.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 2 Comments
  • BTX

    BioTime (BTX +4%) finishes the day higher after saying earlier that it's submitted its Clinical...

    BioTime (BTX +4%) finishes the day higher after saying earlier that it's submitted its Clinical Investigation Protocol to European regulators to begin clinical testing of its Renevia stem cell delivery platform.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • SAP

    SAP (SAP +2.9%) closes higher after announcing its core Business Suite ERP, CRM, and HR apps...

    SAP (SAP +2.9%) closes higher after announcing its core Business Suite ERP, CRM, and HR apps will now be supported by its popular Hana in-memory database. This significantly expands the addressable market for Hana, whose ability to enable real-time analytics and reporting for other SAP apps has already fueled blistering growth. Bernstein has predicted Hana support will also be extended to non-SAP apps. Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) is trying to counter Hana via its costly Exadata X3 system. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • PRTK

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT +9.8%) gets a big boost from U.S. regulators today after the FDA...

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT +9.8%) gets a big boost from U.S. regulators today after the FDA declined to lower the recommended dose of it's Intermezzo prescription sleep aid because the drug's label already recommends a lower dosage for women than men because of their smaller average size. The agency said it believes the bedtime dose of Ambien, Edluar and Zolpimist should be reduced from 10 milligrams to 5 milligrams because the drugs can impair alertness and driving ability in some people the next morning.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • CLDX

    Shares of Celldex Therapeutics (CLDX +4.3%) gain today on the back of positive comments out of...

    Shares of Celldex Therapeutics (CLDX +4.3%) gain today on the back of positive comments out of Cantor, calling the stock one of its top sector picks for 2013. The firm says that company has a solid pipeline, and visibility should to increase this year, mitigating the stock's risk. The firm maintains a Buy rating on the shares, but raises its price target to $13 from $9.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (HLF -3.4%) gives back gains from this morning as the burst of activity ahead of the...

    Herbalife (HLF -3.4%) gives back gains from this morning as the burst of activity ahead of the call wanes. With the stock up 65% from when Bill Ackman first made his accusations, its only natural to assume that there might be some "sell the news" reaction at some point once HLF's presentation ended. However, the picture gets muddled when big guns like Loeb, Chapman and possibly Carl Icahn come to its defense. It may just be more likely that a short squeeze lurks somewhere over the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (MNST -4.5%) slips lower as more negative sentiment builds up. Though no...

    Monster Beverage (MNST -4.5%) slips lower as more negative sentiment builds up. Though no specific news is out, law firm Milberg recently posted an article claiming energy drink manufacturers misled consumers with the claims on their labels and marketing materials.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALT

    PharmAthene (PIP -7%) trades lower today after saying that it's awaiting a ruling after the...

    PharmAthene (PIP -7%) trades lower today after saying that it's awaiting a ruling after the Delaware Supreme Court heard oral arguments today related to on-going litigation against SIGA Technologies. SIGA appealed the final judgment in favor of PIP issued in May, in which PIP was awarded 50% of the net profits over a period of ten years from all sales of SIGA's smallpox antiviral therapeutic, Arestvyr.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • TROX

    Tronox (TROX -5.3%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy with a $21 target price (from $23) at UBS,...

    Tronox (TROX -5.3%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy with a $21 target price (from $23) at UBS, reflecting lower near-term earnings expectations due to TiO2 pricing and demand headwinds the firm expects to persist until at least H1 2013. UBS cuts its forecast of TROX Q4 EPS to a loss of $0.18 based primarily on its revised estimate of TiO2.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • HELE

    Helen of Troy (HELE +3%) gets a lift today from positive comments out of Imperial Capital's Lee...

    Helen of Troy (HELE +3%) gets a lift today from positive comments out of Imperial Capital's Lee Giordano, saying that as the flu season heats up, it may give the stock just the shot in the arm it needs for its FQ4. Giordano notes HELE is well positioned with a diversified product assortment in the healthcare/home environment segment, and the typical flu season falls smack in the middle of it. The firm reiterates its Outperform rating and ups its price target to $38 from $35.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • MY

    Shares of China Ming Yang Wind Power (MY +35.2%) soar as China reportedly plans to double its...

    Shares of China Ming Yang Wind Power (MY +35.2%) soar as China reportedly plans to double its 2013 wind power capacity from last year and is aiming for 10 GW of installed power, up from 7 GW at year-end 2012. Also: BWEN +3.8%, FAN +2.9%, OPTT +1.4%, TRN +0.3%, MTZ +0.2%, KDN +0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (PAY -2%) is lower after RBC downgrades the payment-processing hardware vendor to...

    VeriFone (PAY -2%) is lower after RBC downgrades the payment-processing hardware vendor to Sector Perform. The firm is worried about slowing organic growth and recent revenue misses. Concerns about the impact of Square's card reader and iPad register solutions have already weighed (I, II) on VeriFone shares. RBC has also "downgraded" point-of-sale hardware vendor Micros (MCRS -2.1%) to Outperform from Top Pick.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • HLF

    Pershing Square's Bill Ackman responds to Herbalife's (HLF -3%) Analyst Day presentation, saying...

    Pershing Square's Bill Ackman responds to Herbalife's (HLF -3%) Analyst Day presentation, saying that "Herbalife promised to provide a detailed refutation of each of the facts... Instead, the company distorted, mischaracterized, and outright ignored large portions of our presentation." Ackman notes that HLF explicitly ignored most of his key accusations, such as overstatements and inaccuracies in the company's earnings statement for distributors, which among other deceptions, excludes the 93% of distributors that have zero gross earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 8 Comments
  • VECO

    Veeco (VECO -3.4%) slumps after Deutsche adds the equipment maker to its Solar Short List. More...

    Veeco (VECO -3.4%) slumps after Deutsche adds the equipment maker to its Solar Short List. More than a few investors seem to agree with Deutsche: 27.4% of Veeco's float was shorted as of Dec. 14.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • GOOG

    It looks as if the EC is taking a tougher stance on Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) than the FTC: EU...

    It looks as if the EC is taking a tougher stance on Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) than the FTC: EU antitrust chief Joaquin Almunia says Google will have to change the presentation of its search results in Europe to eliminate the alleged preferential treatment given to its services, or else face antitrust charges. Last week, the FTC let Google off the hook with regards to this charge, arguing the integration of such content improved the quality of Google Search. Yelp (YELP +4.9%) could be getting a boost from the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • HGG

    Electrics retailers move higher with shares of hhgregg (HGG +10.6%) reaching their highest level...

    Electrics retailers move higher with shares of hhgregg (HGG +10.6%) reaching their highest level in close than a month while Conn's (CONN +1.1%) and Best Buy (BBY +4.5%) post more moderate gains. Indications Richard Schulze is still pushing due diligence forward for a Best Buy takeover and the ability of Supervalu to finalize its own sale of assets helped raised the profile of the group, according to traders.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • DNN

    Denison Mines (DNN +2.9%) is upgraded to Outperform by Raymond James after yesterday's update...

    Denison Mines (DNN +2.9%) is upgraded to Outperform by Raymond James after yesterday's update which corroborates high-grade critical mass at the flagship Wheeler River project and consequently increased takeout potential. Also, DNN says its 2013 exploration plans are focused on the Athabasca Basin with 44K meters of drilling planned, a 25% Y/Y increase.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • UCBA

    Midday top 10 gainers: UCBA +48%. NOK +19%. VOXX +17%. NEWL +16%. FSCI +16%. MY +15%. HAST +15%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: UCBA +48%. NOK +19%. VOXX +17%. NEWL +16%. FSCI +16%. MY +15%. HAST +15%. HGG +13%. SVU +12%. PTIE +11%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: MCP -21%. GIG -21%. DRWI -20%. UNXL -14%. OTC:PRXI -8%. QRM -8%. ASNA -8%. THLD -8%. SSRI -8%. PRGN -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • UNXL

    Uni-Pixel (UNXL -14.1%) has tumbled after SA's Xuhua Zhou declares the company's recent run-up...

    Uni-Pixel (UNXL -14.1%) has tumbled after SA's Xuhua Zhou declares the company's recent run-up unjustified, and accuses management of misleading investors. Zhou claims Uni-Pixel's UniBoss touchscreen film tech, recently the subject of a "multimillion-dollar deal" with an unnamed PC vendor, is unlikely to take much share from traditional ITO film tech, judging by forecasts from research firm NanoMarkets. The author also notes comments from researchers who take a critical view of UniBoss, and views Uni-Pixel's IP portfolio as limited.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • LM

    Legg Mason (LM +5.7%) pops on a report it's been approached by some senior managers and P-E...

    Legg Mason (LM +5.7%) pops on a report it's been approached by some senior managers and P-E firms about a buyout. The board turned away the feelers at least until the company has a new CEO, according to sources. Privatizing the company is easier said then done thanks to the high level of firm debt compared to industry peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • CMP

    BMO Capital Markets cuts its target price for Compass Minerals (CMP -4%) to $71 from $72, noting...

    BMO Capital Markets cuts its target price for Compass Minerals (CMP -4%) to $71 from $72, noting CMP's 2.4M-ton highway deicing sales was the smallest Q4 volume since going public and falls well below the 3.5M-ton average since 2004. Snowfall continues to trend below average, impacting salt volumes and potentially leading to pricing pressure in the summer bid season.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • DYSL

    Dynasil (DYSL -6.2%) slips after announcing that Richard Johnson is resigning as chief financial...

    Dynasil (DYSL -6.2%) slips after announcing that Richard Johnson is resigning as chief financial officer and chief accounting officer effective February 4 to pursue other opportunities. The company names Thomas C. Leonard as his successor.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • SOQ

    Sonde Resources (SOQ +1.5%) says it is initiating a process to explore and evaluate potential...

    Sonde Resources (SOQ +1.5%) says it is initiating a process to explore and evaluate potential strategic alternatives in its western Canadian production and exploratory acreage, with the aim of reducing emphasis on legacy producing assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • MILL

    Miller Energy (MILL +2.8%) says the rate it pays to move crude oil on to market on the Cook...

    Miller Energy (MILL +2.8%) says the rate it pays to move crude oil on to market on the Cook Inlet Pipeline system will be lowered from to $3.21/bbbl from $6.17 beginning this month. Also, in its operational update, MILL says the workover on RU-3 in Alaska went as planned to a true vertical depth of 11,400 ft.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU +3.5%) is rallying after JPMorgan argues an improving Chinese economy and rising...

    Baidu (BIDU +3.5%) is rallying after JPMorgan argues an improving Chinese economy and rising mobile revenue (aided by Baidu's iOS search deal) will give the company a lift. The firm thinks mobile, clearly a major concern for the Street, could make up 10% of sales by year's end. Youku Tudou (YOKU +3.5%), which JPMorgan also sees benefiting from the aforementioned trends, is also up. Alibaba's analytics arm recently estimated Qihoo (NYSE:QIHU) took more search share from Baidu in December, but at a slower pace.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (URBN +4.5%) etches out an all-time high after drawing in investors on the...

    Urban Outfitters (URBN +4.5%) etches out an all-time high after drawing in investors on the strength of its solid report on holiday sales. Hedgeye's Brain McGough notes it's one of the only retailers to actually post accelerating comps through the holiday period.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • TSM

    TSMC (TSM +2.3%) provides some cheer for chip stocks by announcing sales for the seasonally weak...

    TSMC (TSM +2.3%) provides some cheer for chip stocks by announcing sales for the seasonally weak month of December were NT$37.1B ($1.28B), -16% M/M but +19% Y/Y. That leads total Q4 sales to amount to NT$131.3B, slightly above guidance of NT$129B-$131B. TSMC's 28nm manufacturing process lead and strong exposure to Apple/Samsung suppliers helped it gain chip foundry share in 2012. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • EXFO

    EXFO (EXFO -1%) dips after posting a $0.03 loss for its FQ1, reversing a year-ago profit as...

    EXFO (EXFO -1%) dips after posting a $0.03 loss for its FQ1, reversing a year-ago profit as telecommunications testing equipment maker posted weak sales. For the current quarter, the company expects its per-share result to range from break even to a loss of $0.04 on revenue of $62M to $67M. Analysts estimates are for a profit of $0.06 per share on revenue of $65M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • TOT

    Total (TOT +1.4%) will halt making new investment in dry shale gas in the U.S. while gas prices...

    Total (TOT +1.4%) will halt making new investment in dry shale gas in the U.S. while gas prices remain low, CEO Christophe de Margerie says, potentially placing at risk its ventures with Chesapeake (CHK -3.5%) in the Utica and Barnett shale areas. TOT plans to continue to invest in countries it considers more promising in shale, such as Denmark, where it intends to spud a shale exploration well this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD +3%) adds to yesterday's gains after CLSA's James Lee starts coverage with an...

    LinkedIn (LNKD +3%) adds to yesterday's gains after CLSA's James Lee starts coverage with an Outperform and $133 PT. Lee thinks LinkedIn is addressing a $70B market opportunity, and declares the company's scale and products "disruptive to the existing war-for-talent game." He also likes LinkedIn's network effects and operating leverage, and sees a chance for the company to succeed in China.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • TXI

    Texas Industries (TXI -2.2%) slips today after its FQ2 missed its bottom line target due to...

    Texas Industries (TXI -2.2%) slips today after its FQ2 missed its bottom line target due to charges, but managed to beat on its top line. Total sales grew by 14% Y/Y, and net losses narrowed as cement sales continue to strengthen. Sales at the cement segment, its biggest by revenue, rose 20% as the division swung to an operating profit, but total sales at the consumer products business slipped 9%. Gross margin also widened to 7% from 1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +3.2%) is trading higher this morning, and so are RF component makers...

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +3.2%) is trading higher this morning, and so are RF component makers Skyworks (SWKS +3.2%), TriQuint (TQNT +2.4%), and RF Micro (RFMD +2.9%). Guidance hikes from Nokia and Apple-dependent Dialog Semi seem to be contributing to the gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • SLCA

    U.S. Silica (SLCA -5%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Jefferies on valuation, as shares have...

    U.S. Silica (SLCA -5%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Jefferies on valuation, as shares have jumped 40% since Sept. 30. While the firm remains supportive of SLCA's business fundamentals, it is not willing to get more aggressive with assumptions for capacity growth and SLCA's ability to retain 50%-plus gross segment margins over the long term.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 2 Comments
  • DRWI

    DragonWave (DRWI -19.9%) plummets after missing FQ3 forecasts and guiding for FQ4 revenue...

    DragonWave (DRWI -19.9%) plummets after missing FQ3 forecasts and guiding for FQ4 revenue $40M-$45M, below a $49.1M consensus. FQ3 gross margin was 19%, up from 15% in FQ2 but down from 41% in the year-ago period, as the company continues to struggle to digest Nokia Siemens' wireless backhaul unit. CC at 11:30AM ET (webcast). (PR) (slides - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (URBN +6%) says its holiday sales increased 15% to $666M, led by strong results...

    Urban Outfitters (URBN +6%) says its holiday sales increased 15% to $666M, led by strong results at Free People and through its direct-to-consumer channels. The tidbit that jumps out: The retailer's gross margins are at an all-time high even with sales heading north.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -1.7%) shares give back yesterday afternoon's bump after J.P. Morgan's...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -1.7%) shares give back yesterday afternoon's bump after J.P. Morgan's upgrade based on expected improved financials, including possible asset sales beyond what CHK has disclosed publicly. The firm says financial risk remains and the stock is not cheap, but believes an improved financial picture likely will help CHK outperform. Shares are cut to Neutral from Buy at SunTrust.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • WYNN

    Casino stocks edge lower, at least partially influenced by word out of Las Vegas that the gaming...

    Casino stocks edge lower, at least partially influenced by word out of Las Vegas that the gaming win on the Strip was down by 13% to $432M during a recent tracking period. The sector is also battling dueling analyst moves: Nomura downgrading MGM Resorts to Neutral from Buy and Lazard upping Wynn Resorts (WYNN +0.4%) to Buy from Neutral. Decliners: MGM -2.7%, LVS -1.5%, PENN -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 2 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP -19.3%) plummets at the open after projecting lower-than-expected revenue and cash...

    Molycorp (MCP -19.3%) plummets at the open after projecting lower-than-expected revenue and cash flow this year due to weakening rare earth prices. J.P. Morgan cuts its price target on shares to $5 from $8: "We continue to believe MCP will likely have to seek additional capital beyond just a revolver and/or equipment leaseback." AVL -3.9%, REE -3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 2 Comments
  • SWY

    Select grocery store operators get a lift after Supervalu's deal with Cerberus raises the...

    Select grocery store operators get a lift after Supervalu's deal with Cerberus raises the profile on the sector. SWY +1.2%, KR +1.2%, DEG +3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • BJRI

    BJ Restaurants (BJRI -3.5%) gives an initial update on sales for Q4, saying comparable store...

    BJ Restaurants (BJRI -3.5%) gives an initial update on sales for Q4, saying comparable store sales grew 3% and total revenue was $184.8 during the period. CEO Jerry Deitchle admits the restaurant operator saw "choppy" traffic, but notes the company will remain "sales-builders" first and foremost with plans to open as many as 17 new restaurants in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures build on earlier gains despite worse-than-expected jobless...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures build on earlier gains despite worse-than-expected jobless figures, with sentiment buoyed by strong export figures from China and falling Spanish bond yields. The S&P benchmark is +0.4%. Nokia surges 22% after saying Q4 earnings were better than it expected, while Herbalife is +0.9% but down sharply from earlier highs as a much anticipated investor meeting gets underway. Later : Bloomberg Consumer Comfort Index, Wholesale Trade, Lots of Fed speak
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • NOK

    Premarket gainers: NOK +20%. SVU +19%. NEWL +18%. QLIK +8%. CRUS +7%. STM +5%. Losers: MCP -12%....

    Premarket gainers: NOK +20%. SVU +19%. NEWL +18%. QLIK +8%. CRUS +7%. STM +5%.
    Losers: MCP -12%. ASNA -12%. ARO -9%. TIF -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • SVU

    More on Supervalu (NYSE:SVU): The Wall Street Journal reports that in addition to buying...

    More on Supervalu (NYSE:SVU): The Wall Street Journal reports that in addition to buying Albertson's, Cerberus also plans to offer to take a stake in Supervalu (SVU) at $4 a share. SVU +16.5% premarket to $3.54 with no formal announcement from the companies on record just yet.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • SVU

    Supervalu (NYSE:SVU): FQ3 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $7.9B (-5% Y/Y) in-line....

    Supervalu (NYSE:SVU): FQ3 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $7.9B (-5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +15% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • SVU

    Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) strikes a deal with Cerberus to offload its Albertson's chain for $100M in...

    Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) strikes a deal with Cerberus to offload its Albertson's chain for $100M in cash. SVU +16.2% premarket to $3.55.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM | 2 Comments

  • Retail analysts start to get a little edgy after an early round of reports on holiday sales...

    Retail analysts start to get a little edgy after an early round of reports on holiday sales (Aeropostale, Tiffany, Ascena Retail Group) show considerable weakness in consumer spending.
